Chapter on Hells, Part Two
Again, the bhiká¹£us contemplate the AvÄ«ci Hell, the sixth separate place called the Unpleasant Place.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see, hear, and know:

Evil people always think of killing sentient beings. In order to hunt and kill, they roam the forests and fields, blowing conches and beating drums, using various methods to make great evil sounds, the sounds are extremely frightening. The sentient beings in the forests, such as deer, birds, lions, tigers, leopards, bears, and monkeys, roam fearlessly. The doers of evil act in this way in order to kill. In order to hunt and kill, they roam the forests and fields;
In order to serve the king or those like the king.
Because of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and life ends, they fall into the AvÄ«ci Hell and are born in the Unpleasant Place.

As the causes of karma are similar, one experiences the results accordingly. Just as when one acts, causing the minds of other sentient beings to be displeased, one falls into hell, enters the flames, and is eaten by birds with flaming beaks and extremely evil voices, foxes, crows, vultures, dogs, jackals, and so forth, eating their ear faculties, causing their minds to be displeased;
There are evil sounds there, the most extremely evil, unlikable, and unpleasant to hear, the most frightening of all sounds;
Diamond-beaked insects enter their bones, move within their bones, and eat their ears;
In this way, until their evil karma is exhausted.

Like a maá¹‡á¸ala fish swimming in the river of desire, with a mind of anger swirling and churning, drifting in the rapids of birth and death, always staying in the mountains of birth and death, divided into desire, anger, and ignorance, greedy for a little taste of desire, hooked by the hook, always walking in the deep waters of wrong views, in the three realms either falling or being born, taking the body as smooth, always thirsting for sound, touch, taste, form, and smell, such sinful karma, when committing it one laughs happily, but when receiving the retribution of suffering one cries and receives it.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
The deluded mind is like a maá¹‡á¸ala fish, dwelling in the house of desire,
When committing karma one laughs happily, but when receiving suffering one cries.
If the evil karma is exhausted there and then one is released, one is reborn among hungry ghosts and animals.

If in their past lives in the distant past they had even a little good karma, if they are born among humans, they will always be sorrowful, and at all times they will hear inauspicious sounds, their minds never joyful. This is called always hearing disadvantageous things:
the death of wife and children, the loss of wealth, misfortune befalling relatives, being killed or bound, always feeling sad and sorrowful, their minds never happy.
That unwholesome karma is similar to its cause and effect.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u observes the Hells of Revival, the seventh separate place called the Place of Extreme Suffering.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He sees, hears and knows:
Those who engage in evil deeds, when committing evil deeds, have deep and heavy afflictions, are extremely hateful and evil, kill many sentient beings and act recklessly.

Due to the causes and conditions of that evil karma, when their bodies perish and their lives end, they fall into the Hells of Revival and are born in the Place of Extreme Suffering, experiencing the extremely heavy suffering of hot iron fire, falling down steep cliffs, iron hooks and flaming garlands;
They suffer like this, without rest, day and night without interruption.

Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the fruits of karma, seeking the city of nirvÄá¹‡a, knowing the suffering and distress of birth and death in the world, observes the place of the great hell Black Rope.
What other places are there in the great hell Black Rope?
He sees, hears and knows:
In the Black Rope hell, there is a place called Equal Suffering, where the suffering of burning is continuous.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He sees, hears and knows:
If a person expounds the Dharma based on evil views and arguments, using all false reasons and analogies;
Disregarding everything, they throw themselves off cliffs to commit suicide;
They have no correct and wholesome precepts.

Due to the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into the great hell Black Rope and are born in the place of Equal Suffering, experiencing great suffering. They undergo extreme suffering:

They are placed on a steep cliff, countless yojanas high, bound with hot black ropes, and then pushed to fall onto the hot iron knives below, where they are eaten by the iron flaming-toothed dogs, with every part of their bodies torn apart and separated;
They cry out in distress, but there is no one to save them, no one to protect them, no one to whom they can appeal for help, no one to comfort them and free them from suffering.
Deceived by their own minds, they are in the wheel of birth and death, constantly and swiftly turning, blind and ignorant, their bodies like a burning black forest on the ground of that hell;
They see the people of Yama, who reproach them with painful verses:
You, foolish one with wrong views, bound by the snare of delusion,
Now fall into this hell, into the great ocean of suffering,
Evil views burn up your merit, you are the vilest among humans,
You fear the bonds of hell, this is your home.
If one belongs to wrong views, that person is not wise,
All the actions of hell, deceived by the mind of an enemy.
The mind is the foremost enemy, this enemy is the worst,
This enemy can bind a person and send them to Yama.
The mind always runs to various objects, never practicing the true Dharma,
Deluded by the path of true Dharma, sent to be killed in hell.
The mind is uncontrollable, even worse than a great raging fire,
Quickly moving and uncontrollable, dragging people to hell.
The mind is the most difficult to control, this fire is worse than fire,
Difficult to control and moving quickly, in hell within hell.
If the human mind is free, it will act in hell;
If a person can control the mind, they will not suffer distress.
Desire is the foremost fire, delusion is the foremost darkness,
Hatred is the foremost enemy, these three control the world.
When you previously did evil, you thought and did it yourself,
You foolishly did it, now you receive this evil retribution.
You liked to steal others' things, to secretly have others' wives,
Always killing sentient beings, deceived by your own mind;
Such karma is powerful, it brings you to this place,
This is your own evil karma, why do you moan like this?
If a person does evil, and later regrets it, he is foolish,
He will not obtain the fruits of retribution, like planting seeds in salty soil.
Desire has little sweet benefit, but the suffering retribution is great,
Foolish people are attached to desire, they go from darkness to darkness.
Foolish people do evil, for the benefit of their wives and children,
Alone they receive the suffering of hell, deceived by their own karma.
If for the sake of wife and children, one creates various evil karmas,
One will arrive at this hell and now experience this suffering and distress.
Neither wife, nor children, nor wealth, nor knowledge can save one,
When a person is about to die in the human realm, there is no one who can protect them.
If a person is tainted by lustful thoughts and deceived by desire,
And together they follow and engage in [unwholesome actions], now they experience such suffering.
Originally, for the sake of sense objects, one has already been deceived by desire,
Having created these evil karmas oneself, why are you now moaning and wailing?'

In that place of wailing and experiencing suffering, the Yama demons punish crimes in this way. The hell beings experience suffering in this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years they experience the utmost suffering, until finally their evil karma is scattered, destroyed, and completely rotten, and only then are they able to escape.

If in a past life, a long time ago, there was good karma that matured, if reborn among humans, due to unwholesome karma, they are in a border region - in the countries of Tavyavati, Papravati, on the shores of the ocean, in the region of Sindhu, in the region of an island - they are robbed by people and their wealth is plundered, they become slaves in a place of extreme suffering and poverty;
if they become gate guards, their bodies are crippled;
all their limbs are inferior and incomplete;
they are tormented by hunger and thirst, and afflicted by cold and heat, like an arrow shot, they experience extreme suffering;
they are always falsely accused, and are beaten by children with wood, stones, and bricks;
they are despised by all people;
they have no wife, no children;
they are the most ordinary and lowly among all people, and experience the greatest suffering;
the remaining karmic retributions are similar to the causes, and the conditions are similar to the original actions, and later they experience accordingly.
If that bhiká¹£u observes in this way the extremely painful karmic retribution of the dark and gloomy hells, he will attain freedom from the bonds of desire in the cycle of birth and death.

Furthermore, the practitioner observes that bhiká¹£u who is always diligent and energetic, who sees the fruits of karma, who practices well and correctly, who is disgusted with the entire cycle of birth and death in the world, who severs the extremely firm bonds of MÄra, who is unwilling to dwell in the realm of MÄra, who does not enjoy dwelling together with afflictions, and whose mind does not delight in or enjoy the attachment and love of defilements.

The earth-dwelling yaká¹£as see that bhiká¹£u possessing such virtues, and they further report it to the sky-dwelling yaká¹£as, as explained above, and so on up to the gods of the great brahma realm, as explained above.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u observes the great hell of black ropes and sees another place called the black rope hell of candÄlas.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
He sees:
Some people use bedding and utensils, and medicine for illness, which are not suitable for them, and consume them excessively;
Lay people, out of foolishness and concealment of evil deeds, either kill sheep themselves or instruct others to kill, as deceived by non-Buddhist Brahmins.

Due to the causes and conditions of these evil deeds, when that person's body perishes and life ends, they fall into a bad place, the Black Rope Hell, and are born in the Chandala place, experiencing great suffering, namely:
Evil birds, either crows, vultures, or evil pigs, pluck out their eyes;
The hell warden, either with a hammer and shackles, or with a large ax, or with evil fire, extremely angry and furious, oppresses them with various sufferings.
Having been born in such a hell, they further experience various extremely heavy sufferings, namely:
Prying out eyes, or pulling out their tongues, all parts of the body are pulled out one by one;
Drinking molten copper;
Three-pronged hot iron, piercing their bodies everywhere;
Their feet are cut off and eaten by crows and birds;
All kinds of illnesses gather, crying and wailing, without a master or companion;
The people of Yama are extremely angry and beat them.
Thus, in the Black Rope Hell, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, until their evil karma is exhausted and rotten, they are then able to escape.
If in past lives, their good karma from the distant past is not yet ripe, they are born among hungry ghosts and animals;
If born among humans, they have a hunchback, blind eyes, and a short lifespan. After death among humans, they again enter the evil paths.

Thus, sentient beings are bound by the chains of karma. Those who practice good deeds will obtain good rewards, while those who do evil deeds will obtain evil retributions. Bound by the fruits of karma, they always remain in the cycle of birth and death.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u observes the place in the Black Rope Great Hell called the Fearful Vulture Place. Due to what karma are sentient beings born in that place?
He sees:
Some people, for the sake of wealth, kill others, binding them, starving them, or depriving them of food and drink.

Due to the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when their bodies perish and their lives end, they fall into the evil realms, into the Black Rope Hell, and are born in the place of fearsome vultures, experiencing great suffering.

In that hell, the iron ground is ablaze, all of it the color of water, ten thousand yojanas in circumference, with flames spreading everywhere. There are iron thorns with which the hell denizens are violently struck, running constantly day and night;
Blazing flames, swords, and halberds, drawn bows and crossbows, and arrows chase after them;
Iron awls constantly pierce them as they run;
The Yama hell wardens wield flaming iron swords, halberds, and arrows, chopping, striking, and shooting them;

They only run in that place, tormented by hunger and thirst, their lives always on the verge of ending, with no rescue or refuge, their breath about to cease, only barely alive, fully experiencing all the sufferings inflicted by others.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
Many people follow each other, creating unwholesome karma.
Later, when the unwholesome karma ripens, they alone experience the results.
Fire, knives, enemies, and poisons, although harmful, are still bearable,
But the suffering after creating evil karma surpasses this.
Relatives all separate, only karma does not abandon one,
Good and evil in the future, all follow one at all times.
Wherever the flower goes, its fragrance also follows;
If one creates good or evil karma, it follows in the same way.
Birds rely on forests, leaving in the morning and gathering in the evening,
Beings are also like this, later they will reunite.
Destroying others' superior affairs, taking for oneself and dominating others,
Whatever evil karma one creates, that person is deceived by delusion.
If one does not proceed to nirvana, nor go to the heavens,
That deluded one's foremost cause is to go from darkness into darkness again.

Thus, that person himself creates evil karma and experiences the suffering of hell for countless hundreds of thousands of years, transmigrating through hell until his evil karma is destroyed and exhausted, only then is he liberated.
He is then reborn as an animal or hungry ghost;

If reborn among humans, he becomes a shepherd, raising camels or other animals, cows, donkeys, or wild mares, like an elephant or dog, always driving donkeys and camels, making a living by various means;
If he becomes a soldier or a general, he is poor and short-lived.
The remaining causes of contemptible and evil karma have similar karmic retributions.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u observes the place of the Black Rope Great Hell, universally observing the sixteen separate places, like the Living Hell;

The bhiká¹£u also observes the Reviving Hell and the Black Rope Hell. Having observed, he knows the Dharma of karmic retribution. All evil karmic retributions are firm. Some are created and accumulated, some are accumulated but not created, and some are created but not accumulated.
That which is created and accumulated will definitely be experienced;ğŸ”½that which is accumulated but not created will not definitely be experienced;
that which is created but not accumulated will not definitely be experienced.

He sees, hears, and knows the three kinds of evil karma and their karmic retributions. Having understood them as they really are, he generates disgust and observes the places where the ropes of karma bind each other.
He also observes the innumerable kinds of karma and also observes the innumerable kinds of mind's movement and grasping.
The bhiká¹£u observes in this way and sees that the minds of sentient beings are free. He also observes the other hells. He sees, hears, and knows:
The third hell is called the Combined Hell.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born there?
Namely, creating and accumulating evil and unwholesome karma, which burns and cooks sentient beings.
He sees, hears, and knows:
Sentient beings create and accumulate three kinds of evil karma, and are born in the Saá¹ƒghÄta Hell, where they experience the evil retribution, namely killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.
These three kinds of evil and unwholesome karma lead to rebirth in the Saá¹ƒghÄta Hell.
The upper evil karma leads to rebirth in this fundamental hell, while the middle and lower evil karma lead to separate locations, with three levels of suffering: upper, middle, and lower.
Moreover, when committing the karma, the power of the mind is different, so the lifespan experienced there has upper, middle, and lower levels.
Moreover, when committing the karma, the power of the mind's mental objects has upper, middle, and lower levels, and the suffering experienced there has upper, middle, and lower levels.
The three kinds of karma are definite: bodily karma has three kinds, verbal and mental karma have three kinds, namely upper, middle, and lower;
Moreover, there are three kinds:
Rebirth in the desire realm, rebirth in the form realm, and rebirth in the formless realm;
There are also three kinds, namely past, present, and future;
There are also three kinds, namely those experienced in the present life, those experienced in the next life, and those experienced in subsequent lives;
There are also three kinds, namely
wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate;
There are also three kinds,
namely present bondage, intermediate bondage, and bondage to different realms;

There are also three kinds, namely bondage to humans and non-humans, bondage to non-humans and humans, and bondage to one's own realm, namely abandoning the human body and attaining a human body again.
Engaging in hellish karma, the power of this karma is similar to what is done, and one is born according to similar karma.
Like the liberated arhat, there are also three kinds:
One is the doer, two are not the doer, and three are bound and then do.
The so-called doer is the initial practice of asceticism;
The so-called bound doer is the subsequent continuous bondage;
The so-called non-doer is up to the attainment of arhatship.
Moreover, the doer, having become a monk, practices the conduct of a monk.
Moreover, the bound doer, having fallen from this place, is born in another place.
Moreover, there are three kinds:
First, the bondage of meditation, second, the bondage not of meditation, and third, the bondage without retribution.
The bondage of meditation refers to the first dhyÄna stage and the second dhyÄna stage, not the third dhyÄna and not the fourth dhyÄna;
The bondage not of meditation refers to giving, precepts, and so forth;
The bondage without retribution refers to the arhat, whose defilements are exhausted, and who definitely receives karma but does not obtain retribution.

That bhiká¹£u observes that the ocean of the world is bound by the net of karma, mutually causing each other to be born, with the fruits of karma, not having a doer, not having a receiver, not without causes and conditions, but only having the power of karma.
That bhiká¹£u, thus contemplating, destroys the army of MÄra and cultivates good dharmas. He further contemplates the hells of combined karma, the causes and fruits of karma.
How do sentient beings give rise to the fundamental Saá¹ƒghÄta Great Hell?
He sees:
If a person kills, steals, and engages in sexual misconduct, enjoying it and doing it often,
such karma is universal and ultimate, and if enjoyed and done often, that karma will give rise to the fundamental hells and their separate locations.

That person will experience great suffering in that fundamental hell, and the karma is as described above. If a person steals and engages in sexual misconduct, that person is called one who engages in sexual misconduct.
What is meant by wrong?
Such different actions are further distinguished.
If a person engages in sexual misconduct with the wife of a venerable one, that person will be born in the Saá¹ƒghÄta Great Hell and experience great suffering, namely:
An iron flaming-beaked vulture will take out its intestines and hang them on the top of a tree to eat;

there is a great river called Abounding in Iron Hooks, in which the iron hooks are all burning. The Yama demons grab the hell beings and throw them into that river, where they fall onto the iron hooks.

Moreover, in that river there are hot flaming swords. The sinners there experience great suffering, a suffering that is incomparable and without analogy. This is called the suffering of burning hooks, meaning that burning hooks strike their bodies;
The Yama demons seize the hell beings and place them in that river, pressing them down so that they sink. Those hell beings alternately submerge each other;
Having submerged each other, they cry out and wail.
In the river, it is not water, but hot molten copper, which floats those sinners like floating wood, swirling and not stopping, thus burning and boiling them, causing great suffering.
Having already been burned and floated in that iron hook river, those hell beings, some have bodies like the sun at dawn;
Some have bodies that sink like heavy stones;
Some cling to the riverbank and do not sink in;
Some sinners have bodies like water-soaked clothes;
Some are eaten by flaming-beaked iron eagles as if eating fish;
Some had their bodies melted, their bodies like lumps of fresh butter;
some were beaten with iron bricks;
some had their bodies broken into hundreds of thousands of pieces like sand balls;
some were in rivers like molten copper;ğŸ”½some were burned with hot ashes;
some had their bodies pinned with flaming tongs and placed in hot ashes, and then pierced with iron tongs;
some had their bodies torn apart like fine threads, and were pulled and beaten;
some pulled their heads, with their heads below and above, and beat them;
some were placed in cauldrons and boiled in hot water like hot beans;
some in cauldrons were turned over and over quickly;
some were placed in cauldrons leaning against one side, raising their hands to the sky and crying out, some crying out together, suffering greatly for a long time with no master and no savior.
There are many flaming-beaked vultures, jackals, and dogs on the hot ground, eating without killing;
Suffering in private, each not seeing the other.

Various causes and conditions, various sufferings, they experience countless hundreds of thousands of sufferings, deceived by their own minds, obtained from the ten unwholesome deeds and wrong conduct, obtained from killing, obtained from stealing.
Furthermore, it is like this:
The Yama demons strike the sinners with iron flaming hammers. The sinners run in fear, looking in the four directions, hoping for rescue, and say:ğŸ”½'Who can save me?
Where can I go for refuge?

They run in the four directions, looking up, and after doing this, the flaming hammer strikes them, placing them in a flaming river, or on a flaming tree, mountain cliff, rock, or caveâ€”in extremely dangerous places. They experience various sufferings, such as being hung upside down from a tree and then pushed down onto a ground of iron hooks, their bodies torn and split like this a thousand or a hundred thousand times.
Furthermore, it is like this:

The Yama demons seize the hell beings and place them on a tree of sword leavesâ€”the sword leaves are extremely numerous and the flames burn fiercely. The sinners see beautiful, well-proportioned, and adorned women on the treetops, and upon seeing this, they give rise to extreme attachment.

In this way, the women are adorned with beautiful garlands, their bodies are sprinkled with fragrant powders, and fragrant ointments are applied to their bodies. Their bodies are the most beautifully adorned, extremely soft and supple, with slender and long fingernails and toenails. They smile pleasantly, and their bodies are adorned with various jewels. With various seductive charms, when foolish ordinary people see them, their minds are captivated.
When the hell beings see such beautiful women on the trees, they give rise to this thought:
'These are the ones I saw among people before, these are the ones I had before.'
The hell beings see this because they are deceived by their own karma;

having seen this, they climb the trees. The leaves of the trees are like knives, cutting their flesh;ğŸ”½having cut the flesh, they next cut the sinews;ğŸ”½having cut the sinews, they next cut the bones;
having cut the bones, they next split the marrow.
Having thus been cut and torn everywhere, he then climbs the tree, wanting to approach the woman. His mind becomes focused, deceived by his own thoughts. On that tree, he experiences such suffering.
Having climbed the tree, he sees that woman again on the ground.
Having seen her, that woman, with eyes bewitching with desire, calls out to that man with a beautiful voice. First, with sweet words, she says:
'Thinking of you, I came to this place. Why don't you come near me now?
Why don't you embrace me?'
In this way, the hell is created by the transformation of karma.
The criminal sees this and his lustful thoughts become rampant. The leaves of the sword tree then descend again in order.

When the man descends, the sword leaves point upwardâ€”blazing with raging flames, sharp as a razor. In this way, the sharp sword first cuts his flesh, then severs his sinews, then cuts his bones, then cuts his blood vessels, then cuts his marrow, and wounds his entire body.
The hell being is thus cut and split. After each blood vessel is severed, he looks at the woman, his mind burning with lust and love.
Having looked in this way, a vulture with flaming beak pecks out his eyes. Blazing sword leaves first cut off his ears. Having been cut in this way, he cries out and howls.
Blazing sword leaves next cut off his tongue, then cut off his nose. In this way, he is cut all over his body, his mind drawn by lust and love.
In this way, he reaches the ground. Having reached the ground, the woman is again on the treetop. The man sees her and climbs the tree again, as described above.

Due to the power of that karma, for such immeasurable hundreds of thousands of years, for such immeasurable hundreds of thousands of millions of years, deceived by their own minds, they turn and wander in that hell.
Those hell beings are thus burned. What causes them to be burned?
Wrong desires are the cause.
Those people are thus still not abandoning desire. Since beginningless time, the mind turns and wanders in hell, hungry ghosts, and animals.
The mind of sentient beings cannot be controlled. Even in hell, it is still like this. One should know that this mind cannot be trusted.

Furthermore, in that Saá¹ƒghÄta Great Hell, there is a mountain called 'Garuá¸a Everywhere.' Those hell beings run to that mountain with their bodies burned and hungry and thirsty. On that mountain, there are iron garuá¸as with flaming beaks everywhere. Their bodies are strong and their bellies are large. Inside the bodies and bellies of those iron garuá¸as, there are hell beings called 'fire people.'
The hell beings, hoping for rescue and refuge, rush to the mountain;
when they reach the mountain, the iron vultures first break their heads, open their skulls, and take out their brains, and then pick out their eyes;
the hell beings cry out in distress, but there is no one to save them;
after breaking their heads, they drink up their brains and throw their heads elsewhere;
the hell beings, without heads and eyes, again run towards the dark hell, by the power of their evil karma.
There are also iron vultures, whose bodies are extremely large, and in their bellies are all fire people, who come towards the sinners, and when they arrive, they swallow them.
The hell beings enter the vulture's belly and become fire people;
this is caused by the evil karma of originally violating others' wives.
The cause of killing, which they enjoyed doing and did much of, lasts for countless hundreds of thousands of years, always being burned but not dying.
The causes of sexual misconduct, when enjoyed and done much, will see women in the sword-leaf forest.
The causes of stealing, when enjoyed and done much, will enter a different hell in one place, where there is a river called Endless Other Shore, filled with boiling copper juice.

The hell beings see the other shore of the river, with many kinds of the best pure food, khadani food, pÅ«jÄni food, good bedding, and good tree forests, with deep shadows in the forests, and also ponds, flowing rivers, and clear water.
Having seen this, the hell beings will make a loud sound, calling out to each other, saying:
'Come, come!
I have now found happiness.
Now there are many kinds of khadani food, pÅ«jÄni food, and good bedding.'
As explained above.
The other hell beings, hearing this cry, all run together, thinking there is a savior, thinking there is a refuge, and gather in one place, asking each other:
'Where can we find happiness now?
What savior, what refuge?'
Then another person, not called, comes and points out to them, saying:
'You should now look at the other shore of the endless river, where there are many kinds of food, such as cooked rice and porridge, trees with bedding and robes, and cool shade.'
As explained above.
All the hell beings gather together like this and run together to the other shore of the endless river.
In the river, there are bubbles of boiling white lead and boiling tin.
The hell beings, running like this, fall into the river;

Some have bodies like lumps of fresh butter, some melt away, some are eaten by flaming-beaked crows, some are eaten by hot flaming-mouthed evil fish, and some have their bodies scattered and melt away.
The hell beings in that river experience all these sufferings. This is caused by the power of the evil karma they have created and accumulated, and they experience these sufferings accordingly.

The hell beings are thus burned, boiled, cooked, and melted for countless hundreds of thousands of years, until their evil karma is destroyed, exhausted, and rotten, and they are then able to escape from that hell.
The Yama demons reprimand the sinful people in that hell, speaking in verse:
Bound by the noose of wife and children, they are brought to the house of hell.
Why were you deceived by the mind and created those evil karmas?ğŸ”½You originally did it for the sake of wife and children,
friends and relatives, and so on,
Committing various evil deeds is not the act of a wise person.
You truly do not love yourself, now arriving at the place of hell.
Why did you commit evil deeds and come here for the sake of your children?
If you deceive for the sake of wife and children and commit various evil deeds,
and later do not regret it in your heart, that person will enter hell.
You alone are burned in hell, devoured by your evil karma,
your wife, children, brothers, and relatives cannot save you.
If you are deceived by delusion and do not perform good deeds,
you will later not obtain happiness, and now you merely regret it in vain.
If you follow the desires, anger, and the foremost deception of the deluded mind,
for the sake of the happiness of wife and children, you will all go down.
One's own karma gives rise to its own fruits, and beings arrive here due to their karma.
Those who perform good deeds are born in the heavens, those who commit evil come to this place.
Thus, the Yama-rÄká¹£asas will repeatedly accuse the hell-dwellers in this way:
'If you yourself created evil karma, now who do you want to make eat such food?
If you create good, you will get good in return;
If you create evil, you will get evil;
If you do not create, you will not get; if you create, you will not lose.
You created this karma yourself, now you get this retribution.'

Thus, the hell-dweller will remain in the Saá¹ƒghÄta hell for a long time, passing through countless hundreds of thousands of years, always being burned and boiled, until his evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy is depleted. Thus, the retribution he receives from killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct, which he enjoyed doing and did much of, is unceasing suffering at all times;
